_exec_summary.SummaryText: The owner of Carson Grain is committed to the prevention of any accidental release of Anhyfrous Ammonia.  If a release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with local aluthorities to mitigate and minimze the impact of the release to people and the environment.Worst case scenario 80000 lbs per minute in a 10 min period of nh3 reculting in a vapor and liquid release, this could effect 1762 residents in an endpoint of 531 milsa according to EPA's RMP Comp (TM) calculations.  This is the failure of one (1) 18,000 gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% capacity, resulting in the release of the total volume in gaseous form)   The alternative release scenerio involves the transport delivery vehicle pulling away from the intake lines into the storage plant without disconnecting the transfer hoses.  The resulting release, according to EPA's RMP*Comp program has a distance of .7 miles.  This facility complies with state and local codes and regulations for anhydrous ammonia storage.  Our facility is inspected annually by a State of Iowa Inspector.  This facility is an ag retail business and we store anhyfrous ammonia for retail to farmer customers.  Our storage consists of 1-18000 gallon tank and 15 small tanks with associates pumps, compressors and plumbing.  Our facility has never had an accident.  Excess flow valves on the lines are present for active mitigation in this analysis as they function to clos when maximum allowable flow conditions exist.  This favility's prevention programs are the elements of OSHA's Process Safety Management Program.  These concepts include; employee participation, analysis of hazards, operation procedures and safe work practices.  Personenel training and maintenance.  In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia system, it is the policy of Carson Grain to notify the Troy Mills Fire Department and the LEPC requestion assistance.  In the event of an accident, immediate emergency response meas

ures will be implemented.  We have no planned changes at this time.                  This Submission revises the RMP dated 6/4/2004. .  Our facility is online and has registered on the RMP site.  We do not use a consultant to prepare the RMP
